etymology.description: 四(四) (sì, "four"), 季(季) (jì, "season"), 豆(豆) (dòu, "bean") combine to describe a vegetable available throughout the year.
etymology.interpretation: The term 四季豆 (sìjìdòu) refers to green beans or string beans, emphasizing their availability in all four seasons. This suggests that they can be grown and consumed year-round.

examples.chinese: 我午饭吃了四季豆(我午飯吃了四季豆)。
examples.english: I ate string beans for lunch.

examples.chinese: 妈妈炒四季豆(媽媽炒四季豆)，加了蒜末(加了蒜末)。
examples.pinyin: Māmā chǎo sìjìdòu, jiāle suàn mò.
examples.english: Mom stir-fried the string beans with minced garlic.

examples.chinese: 我们种了四季豆(我們種了四季豆)，享受健康生活(享受健康生活)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen zhòngle sìjìdòu, xiǎngshòu jiànkāng shēnghuó.
examples.english: We grew string beans, enjoying a healthy life.
